page.title: 03Visit to Morrisholt Farm.
page.content: The farm has been going for a long time - we think it may even date back into the 16th.century.The farm was named after the Morris family (16th. Cent.landowners).The farm has{Fresian, {Hereford,and Guernsey cows}and it covers 90 acres. Forty cows are used for milking. On average,cows produce 2.3 gallons daily. Ten heifers have just had their first calves so will soon be ready for milking.They feed the cows on{dairynuts,carrots, {beetpulp and hay.}25% of the herd is slaughtered annually.Only one person works for Mr.Plaskett so it is hard work to keep the farm in order.At the moment they have{eighteen piglets fed on{pignuts.}Near the farm building there is the old{carter's cottage.}The chimney was used to build Whiteparish bus-shelter. {Free - range hens}are kept for the family's use.
